meanings.definition: The art or practice of speaking in such a manner that the voice appears to come from a source other than the speaker.
meanings.sent1: During the talent show, Sarah amazed everyone with her ventriloquism skills.
meanings.sent2: The ventriloquism performance at the circus was truly captivating.
meanings.sent3: The ventriloquism act made the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her ventriloquism was so convincing, it seemed like the puppet was talking on its own.
meanings.sent5: The ventriloquism demonstration left a lasting impression on the audience.

meanings.definition: The ability to project one's voice so that it appears to come from another location.
meanings.sent1: The ventriloquism of the actor made it seem like the voice was coming from across the room.
meanings.sent2: His ventriloquism was so skillful that it fooled many into thinking he was in a different room.
meanings.sent3: The ventriloquism tricked the audience into looking around for the hidden speaker.
meanings.sent4: With his ventriloquism, he created the illusion of voices echoing in the distance.
meanings.sent5: The ventriloquism technique made it seem like the voice was floating in the air.
